name: sfchronicle
text: Reopening too soon? For the seven-day period through Thursday, cases in Sonoma County rose 41% from the previous seven-day period, to 803. Napa County saw an 11% increase, to 206 cases, in that time. https://t.co/eu8KlR8CQe

name: sfchronicle
text:

Previously, the highest number was 68 new cases, recorded on June 9. https://t.co/cHZz4jylpE

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
At his rally in Tulsa, President Trump said he asked to "slow the testing down." 

"When you do testing to that extent, you're going to find more people, you're going to find more cases. So I said to my people, 'Slow the testing down, please.'" 

https://t.co/wQ4vyUR4it

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Vallejo police are investigating a suspected murder after an adult male died Friday night from at least one gunshot wound.

The death marks the city's 12th murder of 2020 and comes at a difficult time for the police department. https://t.co/giF45vWTPX https://t.co/hrXAsB26MW

name: sfchronicle
text:

‚ÄúAs we navigate uncertainty due to the COVID-19 pandemic, your voice matters," officials said.

name: sfchronicle
text:
St. Helena city officials announced that a mobile testing site will open to everyone who lives or works in the city. 

Testing is open to everyone, even people without coronavirus symptoms. The site will be open Monday and Tuesday (June 22-23).

https://t.co/FVBd6ekNI5

name: sfchronicle
text:
30 people were hospitalized with COVID-19 in San Francisco as of Friday ‚Äî the lowest figure for the city since at least March. The figure had been as high as 90 in early April. 

For more data, visit our Virus Tracker: https://t.co/ritmMhcaSB
